metadata.title: CVE-2019-12625 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
ClamAV versions prior to 0.101.3 are susceptible to a zip bombvulnerability where an unauthenticated attacker can cause a denial ofservice condition by sending crafted messages to an affected system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
